definition: see 生命體徵|生命体征[sheng1 ming4 ti3 zheng1]

sentences.english: We are starting to see some initial signs of improvement.
sentences.chinese: 我們開始看到一些改善的初步跡象。

sentences.english: There were signs of capital outflow.
When reexamined, no trace of cancer was found.
sentences.chinese: 複查時已沒有癌症的跡象。

sentences.english: But there were signs of disagreement among the allies in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 但是有跡象表明在巴黎時盟軍中存在分歧。

sentences.english: Indications point toward a bumper crop.
sentences.chinese: 各種跡象表明豐收在望。

sentences.english: There are also signs that Chinese policymakers are focusing more on shoring up rural infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 還有跡象表明中國的決策者更注重鞏固農鄉基本產業。

sentences.english: By all appearances, this is a moment of reckoning for salt.
sentences.chinese: 各種跡象表明，這是對鹽進行清算的時刻。

sentences.english: Multiple sign-ups shall be grounds for immediate termination of all involved accounts.
sentences.chinese: 多跡象上升將是全部複雜的賬的立即終止的理由。

sentences.english: No signs of influenza-like illness have been reported to date.
sentences.chinese: 迄今未報告流感樣疾病的跡象。

sentences.english: During the actual ovulation period, there are a number of telltale signs.
sentences.chinese: 在真正的排卵期，有一些跡象是你可以注意到的。

sentences.english: To get a pulse, I put my finger in a bullet hole.
sentences.chinese: 我把手指摁在子彈孔上，還有一絲脈搏的跡象。

sentences.english: Tests, such as a computed tomography (CT) scan, may also reveal signs of injury.
sentences.chinese: 計算機斷層掃描等檢測也可能揭示損傷跡象。

sentences.english: There's a natural, high-strung 180 degree angle between these signs.
sentences.chinese: 有一個自然的，高串成180度角之間的這些跡象。

sentences.english: But those who reject our signs, - them shall punishment touch, for that they ceased not from transgressing .
sentences.chinese: 否認我的跡象的人，將爲犯罪而遭受刑罰。

sentences.english: Virgo is an earth sign, putting Saturn's focus on what's here and now.
sentences.chinese: 室女座是地球的跡象，使土星的重點是在這裏和現在。

sentences.english: There are signs that this number is increasing slightly.
sentences.chinese: 有跡象表明這一數字在微微上漲。

definition: to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
to confirm (sth to be true)/to verify
variant of 復甦|复苏[fu4 su1]/to recover (health, economic)/to resuscitate/anabiosis
